Class fuzzyMatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • fuzzyMatch

  • public class fuzzyMatch
extends java.lang.Object
    Fuzzy Matching implemented to compare the similarity between two given strings
    Both strings can be of any length and may contain multiple words
    Objective is to return a score between [0.0, 1.0] based on how similar the two input strings are
    Author:
    Nayem Alam

      • runFuzzyMatching

        private static void runFuzzyMatching(java.lang.String[] testStrings,
                                     java.lang.Double spaceScore,
                                     int numberOfGrams)
        This method performs two Fuzzy Matching algorithms and outputs on Print Stream
        test method to run FuzzyMatching with both FuzzyWithDiceCoefficient and FuzzyWithEditDistance
        Parameters:
        testStrings - list of string pairs
        spaceScore - score between [0.0, 1.0]
        numberOfGrams - number of grams

      • FuzzyWithDiceCoefficient

        private static java.lang.Double FuzzyWithDiceCoefficient(java.lang.String string1,
                                                         java.lang.String string2,
                                                         java.lang.Double spaceScore,
                                                         int numberOfGrams)
        This method performs the fuzzy similarity matching using the dice coefficient
        Parameters:
        string1 - first input string (one or many words)
        string2 - second input string (one or many words)
        spaceScore - score between [0.0, 1.0]
        numberOfGrams - number of grams
        Returns:
        a value between [0.0,1.0] which gives the similarity between two words based on the dice coefficient - values closer to 1.0 have higher similarity

      • getCommonTerms

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCommonTerms(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ngram1,
                                                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ngram2)
        This method finds all the common elements between two array lists
        alternate to retainAll() method
        Parameters:
        ngram1 - list of word(s) diced (i.e. with its corresponding ngrams)
        ngram2 - list of word(s) diced (i.e. with its corresponding ngrams)
        Returns:
        the common terms between two lists

      • getWordMatches

        private static java.lang.Double getWordMatches(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ngram1,
                                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> ngram2)
        This method identifies the positioning of similar words between two lists (i.e. different index but same word)
        Parameters:
        ngram1 - list of word(s) diced (i.e. with its corresponding ngrams)
        ngram2 - list of word(s) diced (i.e. with its corresponding ngrams)
        Returns:
        the number of similar words that are in different positions

      • diceFunction

        private static java.lang.Double diceFunction(double t,
                                             double spaceScore,
                                             int stringLength1,
                                             int stringLength2)
        This method performs the Sørensen–Dice coefficient
        Parameters:
        t - number of common elements between the two input strings
        spaceScore - score that accounts for similar words but positions are mismatched
        stringLength1 - length of string 1
        stringLength2 - length of string 2
        Returns:
        the dice coefficient between two strings

      • nGram

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nGram(int n,
                                                          java.lang.String str)
        This method takes care of both one word and multiple words and removes punctuations from any word
        uses both nGramofManyWords and nGramOfOneWord
        Parameters:
        n - number of grams
        str - any string
        Returns:
        the unigram, bigram, trigram, four-gram, etc... (depending of chosen n) of input str

      • nGramofManyWords

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nGramofManyWords(int n,
                                                                      java.lang.String str)
        This method breaks multiple words into ngrams
        Parameters:
        n - number of grams
        str - multiple words
        Returns:
        the unigram, bigram, trigram, four-gram, etc... (depending of chosen n) of input str

      • nGramOfOneWord

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> nGramOfOneWord(int n,
                                                                    java.lang.String str)
        This method breaks one word into ngrams
        superior method to biGram
        Parameters:
        n - number of grams
        str - one word
        Returns:
        the unigram, bigram, trigram, four-gram, etc... (depending of chosen n) of input str

      • FuzzyWithEditDistance

        private static java.lang.Double FuzzyWithEditDistance(java.lang.String string1,
                                                      java.lang.String string2)
        This method performs the fuzzy similarity matching using the edit distance
        Parameters:
        string1 - word or sentence
        string2 - word or sentence
        Returns:
        a value between [0.0,1.0] which gives the similarity between two words based on their edit distance - values closer to 1.0 have higher similarity

      • editDistance

        public static java.lang.Double editDistance(java.lang.String string1,
                                            java.lang.String string2)
        This method performs the Levenshtein Edit Distance
        Parameters:
        string1 - word or sentence
        string2 - word or sentence
        Returns:
        the edit distance between two strings

      • jaccardIndex

        private static java.lang.Double jaccardIndex(double t,
                                             int stringLength1,
                                             int stringLength2)
        This method performs the Jaccard Coefficient
        Parameters:
        t - number of common elements in both sets
        stringLength1 - number of elements in set 1
        stringLength2 - number of elements in set 2
        Returns:
        the jaccard index

        private static void biGram(java.lang.String str)
        This method breaks one word into bigram(s) (2 adjacent elements from a string of tokens)
        Parameters:
        str - one word input
        Print Streams the bigram(s) of word and the corresponding cardinality

        Returns:
